meanings.definition: Acting or serving as a substitute or deputy
meanings.sent1: The vicarial teacher filled in for the regular teacher when she was sick.
meanings.sent2: The vicarial nurse assisted the doctor during the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The vicarial waiter pretended to be the head chef for a day.
meanings.sent4: Her vicarial role as team captain made her responsible for leading the group.
meanings.sent5: The vicarial firefighter bravely stepped in to help during the emergency.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a vicar or vicariate
meanings.sent1: The vicarial duties involved assisting the vicar in church activities.
meanings.sent2: The vicarial attire worn by the priest was traditional and formal.
meanings.sent3: The vicarial cat seemed to think it was the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: His vicarial connection to the church community was strong and supportive.
meanings.sent5: The vicarial responsibilities included overseeing the parish events.
